identificationModule.briefTitle: Smoking Cessation Program in the Construction Sector
identificationModule.officialTitle: Expanding the Role of the Safety Manager to Implement a Workplace Smoking Cessation Program in the Construction Sector

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The main objective of this study is to identify the optimal adaptive smoking cessation program for the construction sector in terms of effectiveness, cost-effectiveness, and potential implementation.

armGroups.label: Tobacco Quit-line (TQL) Group
armGroups.description: Participants will be referred to the TQL and will be followed up for up to 12 months.

armGroups.label: Brief Behavioral Counseling Group
armGroups.description: Participants will receive one brief behavioral counseling session and be followed up for 12 months.

armGroups.label: Intensive Behavioral Counseling Group
armGroups.description: Participants will receive four behavioral counseling sessions and be followed up for 12 months.

interventions.name: Nicoderm C-Q Gum
interventions.description:
Participants will receive a 6-week supply of nicotine replacement treatment (NRT). Based on participants' self-report on the number of cigarettes smoked, these are the possible dosages of NRT gum (2 mg and 4 mg). Participants should not smoke and use the nicotine gum at the same time. Nicotine gum should only be used when cravings for cigarettes arise and should not be treated like regular chewing gum. It is not to be constantly chewed

NRT will be distributed based on the treatment condition.

interventions.name: Tobacco Quit-line
interventions.description: The TQL is free, and the TQL counselor will provide three phone counseling sessions lasting approximately 15 minutes to devise a specific plan to quit smoking and arrange the delivery of 4 to 12 weeks of NRT based on need. Participants will be advised to request nicotine gums instead of patches to accommodate their job circumstances.

interventions.name: Brief Behavioral Counseling
interventions.description: The counseling session will discuss preparing to quit, coping with job-related stress, getting social support, the "5A's" for preventing relapse (Avoid, Alter, Alternatives, Anticipate, and Active), proper use of NRT, and last approximately 30 minutes.

interventions.name: Intensive Behavioral Counseling
interventions.description: Participants will receive four weekly counseling sessions which include information about how to quit, challenges, and short and long-term relapse prevention. Each session will last approximately 20 minutes.

primaryOutcomes.description: Will be collected as the difference in percentage of participants who quit smoking at the 12-month follow-up assessment between the three treatment groups.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Program Cost-Effectiveness Measured by Number of U.S Dollars
primaryOutcomes.description: Will be measured as the difference in the number of U.S. dollars between the three programs.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Program Cost-Effectiveness Measured by Quality Adjusted Life Years
primaryOutcomes.description: Will be measured by quality-adjusted life years defined as the difference in the number of years lived in perfect health between the three programs.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Program's Implementation- Acceptability Measured by Likert Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Using the Acceptability of Intervention Measure, acceptability will be scored on a 5-point Likert scale, with higher scores indicating greater acceptability.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Program's Implementation- Feasibility Measured by Likert Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Using the Feasibility of Intervention Measure, feasibility will be scored on a 5-point Likert scale, with higher scores indicating greater feasibility.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Program's Implementation- Sustainability Measured by Likert Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Using the Intervention Sustainability Assessment Tool, sustainability will be scored on a 7-point Likert scale, with higher scores indicating greater sustainability.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Company leaders:

* ≥ 18 years
* Involved in decision making
* Willing to participate in the implementation development and evaluation

Safety Managers:

* ≥ 18 years
* Be a safety manager
* No plans to leave the company within the next year
* Bilingual
* Willing to receive training in smoking cessation treatment
* Willing to deliver the smoking cessation treatment to workers

Construction Workers:

* Be a construction worker
* ≥ 18 years
* Have smoked on average 5 or more cigarettes daily for the past year
* Willing to make a serious quit attempt in the next 30 days
* Planning to stay in the company for the next 6 months
* Own a telephone and plan to keep it active for the next 12 months

Exclusion Criteria:

Safety Managers:

- Current cigarette smoker
